column5: Does anyone know for sure if TSA will allow gel cell batteries through airport security to be carried on a plane? We are using them to power our portable fishfinders while fishing in Canada.

According to the TSA website, non-flammable gel up to 3.4 oz is allowed in carry-on. Over that must be in checked. Flammable gel may not be carried on or checked. With the amount of times "gel" is mentioned in the regulations, I'd say trying to carry them on would lead to a lot more hassle than I'd want.
